record.source: The Journal of Physical Chemistry Letters
record.title: Quantum Chemical Density Matrix Renormalization Group Method Boosted by Machine Learning
record.subjects: Quantum Physics ; Chemical Sciences ; Physical Sciences ; Theoretical and Computational Chemistry ; Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence ; Networking and Information Technology R&D (NITRD) ; Chemical sciences ; Physical sciences
record.abstract: The use of machine learning (ML) to refine low-level theoretical calculations to achieve higher accuracy is a promising and actively evolving approach known as Δ-ML. The density matrix renormalization group (DMRG) is a powerful variational approach widely used for studying strongly correlated quantum systems. High computational efficiency can be achieved without compromising accuracy. Here, we demonstrate the potential of a simple ML model to significantly enhance the performance of the quantum chemical DMRG method.
record.contributors: Golub, Pavlo ; Yang, Chao ; Vlček, Vojtěch ; Veis, Libor
